DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity Negation Occurrence Reason ISO21090.DSET.SC.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A judgment of the final state of a person who experienced an adverse event, which takes place after the adverse event occurs. The text and/or code that describes the rationale behind why an activity is not done.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity Negation Occurrence Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The result of an action.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The result of an action.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
